mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an10.18:2.6.pli: ‘Sīlavā vatāyaṁ bhikkhu pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesū’ti therāpi naṁ bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti, majjhimāpi bhikkhū … navāpi bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti.
an10.18:2.6.en: Knowing this, the mendicants—whether senior, middle, or junior—think that mendicant is worth advising and instructing.

an10.18:3.2.pli: ‘Bahussuto vatāyaṁ bhikkhu sutadharo sutasannicayo, ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ abhivadanti, tathārūpāssa dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā’ti therāpi naṁ bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti, majjhimāpi bhikkhū … navāpi bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti.
an10.18:3.2.en: Knowing this, the mendicants—whether senior, middle, or junior—think that mendicant is worth advising and instructing.

an10.18:4.2.pli: ‘Kalyāṇamitto vatāyaṁ bhikkhu kalyāṇasahāyo kalyāṇasampavaṅko’ti therāpi naṁ bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti, majjhimāpi bhikkhū … navāpi bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti.
an10.18:4.2.en: Knowing this, the mendicants—whether senior, middle, or junior—think that mendicant is worth advising and instructing.

an10.18:5.2.pli: ‘Suvaco vatāyaṁ bhikkhu sovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgato, khamo padakkhiṇaggāhī anusāsanin’ti therāpi naṁ bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti, majjhimāpi bhikkhū … navāpi bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti.
an10.18:5.2.en: Knowing this, the mendicants—whether senior, middle, or junior—think that mendicant is worth advising and instructing.

an10.18:6.2.pli: ‘Yāni tāni sabrahmacārīnaṁ uccāvacāni kiṅkaraṇīyāni, tattha dakkho vatāyaṁ bhikkhu analaso, tatrūpāyāya vīmaṁsāya samannāgato, alaṁ kātuṁ alaṁ saṁvidhātun’ti therāpi naṁ bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti, majjhimāpi bhikkhū … navāpi bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti.
an10.18:6.2.en: Knowing this, the mendicants—whether senior, middle, or junior—think that mendicant is worth advising and instructing.

an10.18:7.2.pli: ‘Dhammakāmo vatāyaṁ bhikkhu piyasamudāhāro, abhidhamme abhivinaye uḷārapāmojjo’ti therāpi naṁ bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti, majjhimāpi bhikkhū … navāpi bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti.
an10.18:7.2.en: Knowing this, the mendicants—whether senior, middle, or junior—think that mendicant is worth advising and instructing.

an10.18:8.2.en: Knowing this, the mendicants—whether senior, middle, or junior—think that mendicant is worth advising and instructing.

an10.18:9.2.pli: ‘Santuṭṭho vatāyaṁ bhikkhu itarītaracīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārenā’ti therāpi naṁ bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti, majjhimāpi bhikkhū … navāpi bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti.
an10.18:9.2.en: Knowing this, the mendicants—whether senior, middle, or junior—think that mendicant is worth advising and instructing.

an10.18:10.2.pli: ‘Satimā vatāyaṁ bhikkhu paramena satinepakkena samannāgato, cirakatampi cirabhāsitampi saritā anussaritā’ti therāpi naṁ bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti, majjhimāpi bhikkhū … navāpi bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti.
an10.18:10.2.en: Knowing this, the mendicants—whether senior, middle, or junior—think that mendicant is worth advising and instructing.

an10.18:11.2.pli: ‘Paññavā vatāyaṁ bhikkhu udayatthagāminiyā paññāya samannāgato ariyāya nibbedhikāya sammā dukkhakkhayagāminiyā’ti therāpi naṁ bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti, majjhimāpi bhikkhū … navāpi bhikkhū vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti.
an10.18:11.2.en: Knowing this, the mendicants—whether senior, middle, or junior—think that mendicant is worth advising and instructing.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 10.18
2. A Protector
A Protector (2nd)

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an4.111:4.8.pli: Api ca yo purisadammo saṇhena vinayaṁ na upeti, pharusena vinayaṁ na upeti, saṇhapharusena vinayaṁ na upeti, na taṁ tathāgato vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññati, nāpi viññū sabrahmacārī vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti.
an4.111:4.8.en: But when a person in training doesn’t follow any of these forms of training, the Realized One doesn’t think they’re worth advising or instructing, and neither do their sensible spiritual companions.

an4.111:4.10.pli: yaṁ na tathāgato vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññati, nāpi viññū sabrahmacārī vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññantī”ti.
an4.111:4.10.en: when the Realized One doesn’t think they’re worth advising or instructing, and neither do their sensible spiritual companions.”

an4.111:5.2.pli: yaṁ na tathāgato vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññati, nāpi viññū sabrahmacārī vattabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññantīti.
an4.111:5.2.en: when the Realized One doesn’t think they’re worth advising or instructing, and neither do their sensible spiritual companions.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 4.111
12. With Kesi
With Kesi

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

mn50:15.1.pli: Atha kho te, pāpima, bhikkhū kakusandhena bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena evaṁ ovadiyamānā evaṁ anusāsiyamānā araññagatāpi rukkhamūlagatāpi suññāgāragatāpi mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā vihariṁsu, tathā dutiyaṁ, tathā tatiyaṁ, tathā catutthaṁ. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyābajjhena pharitvā vihariṁsu.
mn50:15.1.en: When those mendicants were instructed and advised by the Buddha Kakusandha in this way, they went to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, where they meditated spreading a heart full of love …

mn50:19.1.pli: Atha kho te, pāpima, bhikkhū kakusandhena bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena evaṁ ovadiyamānā evaṁ anusāsiyamānā araññagatāpi rukkhamūlagatāpi suññāgāragatāpi asubhānupassino kāye vihariṁsu, āhāre paṭikūlasaññino, sabbaloke anabhiratisaññino, sabbasaṅkhāresu aniccānupassino.
mn50:19.1.en: When those mendicants were instructed and advised by the Buddha Kakusandha in this way, they went to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, where they meditated observing the ugliness of the body, perceiving the repulsiveness of food, perceiving dissatisfaction with the whole world, and observing the impermanence of all conditions.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 50
The Condemnation of Māra

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an4.122:2.9.pli: Ime panamhākaṁ puttamattā maññe nattamattā maññe ovaditabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññantī’ti.
an4.122:2.9.en: And now these mendicants—who you’d think were our children or grandchildren—imagine they can advise and instruct us!’

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 4.122
13. Fears
The Danger of Waves

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

mn107:12.2.pli: “kiṁ nu kho bhoto gotamassa sāvakā bhotā gotamena evaṁ ovadīyamānā evaṁ anusāsīyamānā sabbe accantaṁ niṭṭhaṁ nibbānaṁ ārādhenti udāhu ekacce nārādhentī”ti?
mn107:12.2.en: “When his disciples are instructed and advised like this by the worthy Gotama, do all of them achieve the ultimate goal, extinguishment, or do some of them fail?”

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 107
With Moggallāna the Accountant

mn67:16.9.pli: Ime panamhākaṁ puttamattā maññe, nattamattā maññe, amhe ovaditabbaṁ anusāsitabbaṁ maññantī’ti.
mn67:16.9.en: And now these mendicants—who you’d think were our children or grandchildren—imagine they can advise and instruct us!’

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

dn16:6.4.4.pli: So bhikkhūhi neva vattabbo, na ovaditabbo, na anusāsitabbo”ti.
dn16:6.4.4.en: but the mendicants should not correct, advise, or instruct him.”

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 16
The Great Discourse on the Buddha’s Extinguishment
